instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message:
Got this board today, trying to figure out whats wrong with it.
I have gone through all the S5 rails and their all present.

The board is completely dead and [FONT=Verdana, Arial, Tahoma, Calibri, Geneva, sans-serif][SIZE=2][COLOR=#333333]<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> are all missing.[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]

[FONT=Verdana, Arial, Tahoma, Calibri, Geneva, sans-serif][SIZE=2][COLOR=#333333]â€‹I'm assuming this is because the PCH is not getting power, but what powers the PCH?

Help much [/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT][FONT=Verdana, Arial, Tahoma, Calibri, Geneva, sans-serif][SIZE=2][COLOR=#333333]apprechiated :)[/COLOR][/SIZE][/FONT]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message: Check RTC resistors <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1302</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R1303</RESISTOR>, should have about 3.3V on each pin, also check if <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> is present.....

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message:
No ultrasonic yet, the board shows litte damage/corrosion but there are som dried wine on the middle upper part of the board.
I'll check the resistors when I get back.

threads.message: UC and it will work I bet.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message:
Then the board is clean, sorry to say still nothing. I have now measured the resistors <RESISTOR>R1300</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R1304</RESISTOR> and there are 3.3V on all except from <RESISTOR>R1301</RESISTOR> pin 2 which is 3.0V.
When I measure <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> i get 0.4V, I don't have an oscilloscope right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message: the million dollar question, is <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> missing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message: Yes it's missing, I wrote that in the first post

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message: Ok, so I measured quite a bit now. It seems I have all main power rails except S0 rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange light no boot after Wine spill
threads.message:
I had some time again to look over this board, and I have come a bit further, I still can't get it to go into an S0 state. Both <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8160</CHIP> where missing pads.
<RESISTOR>R8165</RESISTOR> was open and Pin 6 on <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> was missing. 

Do anyone have any clue on what to check for next?
